```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(scales)

# Load the data from the CSV file
data <- read_csv("updated_realistic_chs_college_enrollment_data.csv")

# Filter the data for years 2100 onwards
filtered_data <- data %>% 
  filter(year >= 2121)

# Create a dodged bar chart
college_plot <- ggplot(filtered_data, aes(x = college, y = pct, fill = as.factor(year))) +
  geom_col(position = position_dodge2(padding = 0.2)) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = label_percent()) +
  labs(
    title = "Percentage of Enrolled Students by College",
    subtitle = "From 2120 onwards",
    x = NULL,
    y = NULL,
    fill = NULL
  ) 

college_plot
```


```{r}

#install.packages('showtext')
library(showtext)
font_add_google("Montserrat", "Montserrat")

showtext_auto() 

main_font = "Montserrat"

# vinuni color palette - accent colors
# based on branding guideline (page 13) - https://policy.vinuni.edu.vn/all-policies/brand-identity-manual/
vinuni_palette_main <- c("#35426e", "#d2ae6d", "#c83538")
vinuni_palette_accents <- c( "#5cc6d0", "#a7c4d2", "#d2d3d5",  "#4890bd", "#0087c3", "#d2ae6d")

college_plot +
  scale_fill_manual(values = vinuni_palette_accents) +
  theme_minimal(
    base_family = main_font,
    base_size = 11
  ) +
  theme(
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face="bold", colour = vinuni_pallete_main[3]),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face="bold"),
    legend.position = "bottom",
    panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.major.y = element_line(color = "grey", linewidth = 0.2),
    panel.grid.minor.y = element_blank(),
    axis.text = element_text(size = rel(1.0)),
    axis.text.x = element_text(face="bold", colour = vinuni_pallete_main[1]), 
    axis.text.y = element_text(face="bold", colour = vinuni_pallete_main[1]), 
    legend.text = element_text(size = rel(0.9))
  )
showtext_auto() 
```


```{r}

# define theme as its own function
theme_vinuni <- function(
    base_size = 11,
    base_family = main_font,
    base_line_size = base_size / 22,
    base_rect_size = base_size / 22
    ) {
  # start with minimal theme
  theme_minimal(
    base_family = base_family,
    base_size = base_size,
    base_line_size = base_line_size,
    base_rect_size = base_rect_size
  ) +
  theme(
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face="bold", colour = vinuni_pallete_main[3]),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face="bold"),
    legend.position = "bottom",
    panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.major.y = element_line(color = "grey", linewidth = 0.2),
    panel.grid.minor.y = element_blank(),
    axis.text = element_text(size = rel(1.0)),
    axis.text.x = element_text(face="bold", colour = vinuni_pallete_main[1]), 
    axis.text.y = element_text(face="bold", colour = vinuni_pallete_main[1]), 
    legend.text = element_text(size = rel(0.9))
  )
}
```

```{r}
college_plot + 
  scale_fill_manual(values = vinuni_palette_accents) +
  theme_vinuni()
```

```{r}

# Filter to get the top 3 colleges in 2125
top_colleges_2125 <- data %>%
  filter(year == 2125) %>%
  arrange(desc(pct)) %>%
  slice(1:3) %>%
  pull(college)

# Filter the original dataset to include only these colleges
filtered_data <- data %>%
  filter(college %in% top_colleges_2125)

filtered_data |>
  mutate(
    college = fct_reorder2(.f = college, .x = year, .y = pct)
  ) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = pct, color = college)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() +
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(2100, 2125), breaks = seq(2100, 2125, 5)) +
  scale_color_manual(values = vinuni_palette_main) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = label_percent()) +
  labs(
    x = "Year",
    y = "Percent of students admitted",
    color = "College",
    title = "Percentage of Enrolled Students by College",
  ) +
  # use the Cornell theme
  theme_vinuni() +
  # legend does work better on the right for this chart
  theme(
    legend.position = "right"
  )
```
